title: Phototypesetting font experts??
content:
Hello,  
I'm hoping there are some former phototypesetting workers on here or possibly some folks who are knowledgeable in that area. I'm desperately hoping to accurately ascertain a certain font used in various magazines in the 1980s. I've included some examples below from three separate magazines.

Here are the examples:

[http://i1.wp.com/maximumrocknroll.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/NorCal\_...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023022/http:/i1.wp.com/maximumrocknroll.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/NorCal_scene-MRR006_1983.jpg "http://i1.wp.com/maximumrocknroll.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/NorCal\_scene-MRR006\_1983.jpg")

[http://sendbackmystamps.files.wordpress.com/2013/07/editorial-news.jpg?w...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023022/http:/sendbackmystamps.files.wordpress.com/2013/07/editorial-news.jpg?w=949 "http://sendbackmystamps.files.wordpress.com/2013/07/editorial-news.jpg?w=949")

[http://www.thrashermagazine.com/images/image/Features/2009/1983\_mag/8302...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023022/http:/www.thrashermagazine.com/images/image/Features/2009/1983_mag/8302/8302%20800t/8302C2-p1crop800.jpg "http://www.thrashermagazine.com/images/image/Features/2009/1983\_mag/8302/8302%20800t/8302C2-p1crop800.jpg")  
(Left side)

The fonts are neither Signa nor Univers (the G and 9 are slightly different). Any help is greatly appreciated. Thanks so much!!
author: PurgeValve

comments.content:
You will get better results if you post your request to the new type ID forum.  
 [http://typophile.com/typeid](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023022/http:/typophile.com/typeid "http://typophile.com/typeid")  
Don
